description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability when Network Address Translation (NAT) is enabled in Linux 2.2.10 and earlier with ipchains, or FreeBSD 3.2 with ipfw, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (kernel panic) via a ping -R (record route) command.'}]
reference: [{'tags': ['x_refsource_CONFIRM'], 'url': 'http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v2.2/patch-2.2.11.gz'}, {'name': '19990722 Linux +ipchains+ ping -R', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93277426802802&w=2'}, {'name': '6105', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_OSVDB'], 'url': 'http://www.osvdb.org/6105'}, {'name': '19990722 Re: ping -R causes kernel panic on a forwarding machine ( 2.2.5 a nd 2 .2.10)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93277766505061&w=2'}, {'name': 'ipchains-ping-route-dos(7257)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7257.php'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in faxalter in hylafax 4.0.2 allows local users to gain privileges via a long -m command line argument.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Linux kernel before 2.3.18 or 2.2.13pre15, with SLIP and PPP options, allows local unprivileged users to forge IP packets via the TIOCSETD option on tty devices.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'linux-tiocsetd-forge-packets(7858)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/7858'}, {'name': '19991022 Local user can send forged packets', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94061108411308&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': "ICQ ActiveList Server allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via malformed packets to the server's UDP port."}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'HTTP server for Xerox DocuColor 4 LP allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (hang) via a long URL that contains a large number of . characters.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Auto_FTP.pl script in Auto_FTP 0.2 stores usernames and passwords in plaintext in the auto_ftp.conf configuration file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Auto_FTP.pl script in Auto_FTP 0.2 uses the /tmp/ftp_tmp as a shared directory with insecure permissions, which allows local users to (1) send arbitrary files to the remote server by placing them in the directory, and (2) view files that are being transferred.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'PAM configuration file for rlogin in Red Hat Linux 6.1 and earlier includes a less restrictive rule before a more restrictive one, which allows users to access the host via rlogin even if rlogin has been explicitly disabled using the /etc/nologin file.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991007 Problems with redhat 6 Xsession and pam.d/rlogin.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93942774609925&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Xsession in Red Hat Linux 6.1 and earlier can allow local users with restricted accounts to bypass execution of the .xsession file by starting kde, gnome or anotherlevel from kdm.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991007 Problems with redhat 6 Xsession and pam.d/rlogin.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93942774609925&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Linuxconf on Red Hat Linux 6.0 and earlier does not properly disable PAM-based access to the shutdown command, which could allow local users to cause a denial of service.'}]
reference: [{'name': "19990630 linuxconf doesn't seem to deal correctly with /etc/pam.d/reboot", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93220073515880&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'NFS daemon (nfsd.exe) for Omni-NFS/X 6.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via certain packets, possibly with the Urgent (URG) flag set, to port 111.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ARCAD Systemhaus 0.078-5 installs critical programs and files with world-writeable permissions, which could allow local users to gain privileges by replacing a program with a Trojan horse.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Directory traversal vulnerability in KVIrc IRC client 0.9.0 with the "Listen to !nick <soundname> requests" option enabled allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in a DCC GET request.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'mknod in Linux 2.2 follows symbolic links, which could allow local users to overwrite files or gain privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Nosque MsgCore 2.14 stores passwords in cleartext: (1) the administrator password in the AdmPasswd registry key, and (2) user passwords in the Userbase.dbf data file, which could allow local users to gain privileges.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990907 MsgCore mailserver stores passwords in clear text', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93698162708211&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'E-mail client in Softarc FirstClass Internet Server 5.506 and earlier stores usernames and passwords in cleartext in the files (1) home.fc for version 5.506, (2) network.fc for version 3.5, or (3) FCCLIENT.LOG when logging is enabled.'}]
reference: [{'name': "19990909 SoftArc's FirstClass E-mail Client", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93698283309513&w=2'}, {'name': "19990830 SoftArc's FirstClass E-mail Client", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93637687305327&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'BMC Patrol component, when installed with Compaq Insight Management Agent 4.23 and earlier, or Management Agents for Servers 4.40 and earlier, creates a PFCUser account with a default password and potentially dangerous privileges.'}]
reference: [{'tags': ['x_refsource_CONFIRM'], 'url': 'http://www.compaq.com/products/servers/management/advisory.html'}, {'name': '19990817 Compaq PFCUser account', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93542118727732&w=2'}, {'name': '19990915 (I) UPDATE - PFCUser Account,', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93759822430801&w=2'}, {'name': 'management-pfcuser(3231)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/3231'}, {'name': '19991105 UPDATE: SSRT0620 Compaq Foundation Agents v4.40B  PFCUser issues', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=94183795025294&w=2'}, {'name': '19990905 Case ID  SSRT0620  - PFCUser account communication', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93654336516711&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Compaq Integration Maintenance Utility as used in Compaq Insight Manager agent before SmartStart 4.50 modifies the legal notice caption (LegalNoticeCaption) and text (LegalNoticeText) in Windows NT, which could produce a legal notice that is in violation of the security policy.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'compaq-smartstart-legal-notice(7763)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7763.php'}, {'name': '19990902 Compaq CIM UG Overwrites Legal Notice', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93637792706047&w=2'}, {'name': '19990902 Compaq CIM UG Overwrites Legal Notice', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93646669500991&w=2'}, {'name': '19990917 Re: Compaq CIM UG Overwrites Legal Notice', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93759822830815&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Netscape Communicator 4.04 through 4.7 (and possibly other versions) in various UNIX operating systems converts the 0x8b character to a "<" sign, and the 0x9b character to a ">" sign, which could allow remote attackers to attack other clients via cross-site scripting (CSS) in CGI programs that do not filter these characters.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991005 Time to update those CGIs again', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93915331626185&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'When an administrator in Windows NT or Windows 2000 changes a user policy, the policy is not properly updated if the local ntconfig.pol is not writable by the user, which could allow local users to bypass restrictions that would otherwise be enforced by the policy, possibly by changing the policy file to be read-only.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'When the Ntconfig.pol file is used on a server whose name is longer than 13 characters, Windows NT does not properly enforce policies for global groups, which could allow users to bypass restrictions that were intended by those policies.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 4.0 allows local users to cause a denial of service via a user mode application that closes a handle that was opened in kernel mode, which causes a crash when the kernel attempts to close the handle.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 3.51 and 4.0 running WINS (Windows Internet Name Service) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a flood of malformed packets, which causes the server to slow down and fill the event logs with error messages.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Win32k.sys in Windows NT 4.0 before SP2 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) by calling certain WIN32K functions with incorrect parameters.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 3.51 and 4.0 allow local users to cause a denial of service (crash) by running a program that creates a large number of locks on a file, which exhausts the NonPagedPool.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 4.0 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) via an illegal kernel mode address to the functions (1) GetThreadContext or (2) SetThreadContext.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Windows NT searches a user's home directory (%systemroot% by default) before other directories to find critical programs such as NDDEAGNT.EXE, EXPLORER.EXE, USERINIT.EXE or TASKMGR.EXE, which could allow local users to bypass access restrictions or gain privileges by placing a Trojan horse program into the root directory, which is writable by default."}]
reference: [{'name': '515', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/515'}, {'name': '19990628 NT runs Explorer.exe, Taskmgr.exe etc. from wrong location', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93069418400856&w=2'}, {'name': '19990630 Update: NT runs explorer.exe, etc...', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93127894731200&w=2'}, {'name': 'nt-login-default-folder(2336)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/2336'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Pegasus e-mail client 3.0 and earlier uses weak encryption to store POP3 passwords in the pmail.ini file, which allows local users to easily decrypt the passwords and read e-mail.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internet Explorer 5.0 does not properly reset the username/password cache for Web sites that do not use standard cache controls, which could allow users on the same system to access restricted web sites that were visited by other users.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "AV Option for MS Exchange Server option for InoculateIT 4.53, and possibly other versions, only scans the Inbox folder tree of a Microsoft Exchange server, which could allow viruses to escape detection if a user's rules cause the message to be moved to a different mailbox."}]
reference: [{'name': '19990512 InoculateIT 4.53 Real-Time Exchange Scanner Flawed', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=92652152723629&w=2'}, {'name': '20001116 InoculateIT AV Option for MS Exchange Server', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=97439568517355&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Real Media RealServer (rmserver) 6.0.3.353 stores a password in plaintext in the world-readable rmserver.cfg file, which allows local users to gain privileges.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990414 Real Media Server stores passwords in plain text', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=92411181619110&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The setup wizard (ie5setup.exe) for Internet Explorer 5.0 disables (1) the screen saver, which could leave the system open to users with physical access if a failure occurs during an unattended installation, and (2) the Task Scheduler Service, which might prevent the scheduled execution of security-critical programs.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in /usr/bin/write in Solaris 2.6 and 7 allows local users to gain privileges via a long string in the terminal name argument.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Triactive Remote Manager with Basic authentication enabled stores the username and password in cleartext in registry keys, which could allow local users to gain privileges.'}]
reference: [{'name': "19990219 Plaintext Password in Tractive's Remote Manager Software", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91966339502073&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'FORE PowerHub before 5.0.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (hang) via a TCP SYN scan with TCP/IP OS fingerprinting, e.g. via nmap.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'perlshop.cgi shopping cart program stores sensitive customer information in directories and files that are under the web root, which allows remote attackers to obtain that information via an HTTP request.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990427 Re: Shopping Carts exposing CC data', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=92523159819402&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'FileSystemObject (FSO) in the showfile.asp Active Server Page (ASP) allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files by specifying the name in the file parameter.'}]
reference: [{'name': '230', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/230'}, {'name': '19990211 Using FSO in ASP to view just about anything', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91877455626320&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in fpcount.exe in IIS 4.0 with FrontPage Server Extensions allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990114 MS IIS 4.0 Security Advisory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91638375309890&w=2'}, {'name': '19990114 MS IIS 4.0 Security Advisory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91632724913080&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Matt Wright's download.cgi 1.0 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in the f parameter."}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'dbmlparser.exe CGI guestbook program does not perform a chroot operation properly, which allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'DNS allows remote attackers to use DNS name servers as traffic amplifiers via a UDP DNS query with a spoofed source address, which produces more traffic to the victim than was sent by the attacker.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'J-063', 'tags': ['third-party-advisory', 'government-resource', 'x_refsource_CIAC'], 'url': 'http://ciac.llnl.gov/ciac/bulletins/j-063.shtml'}, {'name': 'dns-udp-query-dos(7238)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7238.php'}, {'name': '19990730 Possible Denial Of Service using DNS', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93348057829957&w=2'}, {'name': 'AL-1999.004', 'tags': ['third-party-advisory', 'x_refsource_AUSCERT'], 'url': 'ftp://ftp.auscert.org.au/pub/auscert/advisory/AL-1999.004.dns_dos'}, {'name': '19990810 Possible Denial Of Service using DNS', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93433758607623&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Symantec Norton Utilities 2.0 for Windows 95 marks the TUNEOCX.OCX ActiveX control as safe for scripting, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via the run option through malicious web pages that are accessed by browsers such as Internet Explorer 3.0.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in dbadmin CGI program 1.0.1 on Linux allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'NetWare NFS mode 1 and 2 implements the "Read Only" flag in Unix by changing the ownership of a file to root, which allows local users to gain root privileges by creating a setuid program and setting it to "Read Only," which NetWare-NFS changes to a setuid root program.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': '(1) bash before 1.14.7, and (2) tcsh 6.05 allow local users to gain privileges via directory names that contain shell metacharacters (` back-tick), which can cause the commands enclosed in the directory name to be executed when the shell expands filenames using the \\w option in the PS1 variable.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19960919 Vulnerability in expansion of PS1 in bash & tcsh', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.dataguard.no/bugtraq/1996_3/0503.html'}, {'name': '19960913 tee see shell problems', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167419868&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Indigo Magic System Tour in the SGI system tour package (systour) for IRIX 5.x through 6.3 allows local users to gain root privileges via a Trojan horse .exitops program, which is called by the inst command that is executed by the RemoveSystemTour program.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in ppp program in FreeBSD 2.1 and earlier allows local users to gain privileges via a long HOME environment variable.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Perl 5.004_04 and earlier follows symbolic links when running with the -e option, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the /tmp/perl-eaXXXXX file.'}]
reference: [{'tags': ['x_refsource_CONFIRM'], 'url': 'http://www.redhat.com/support/errata/rh50-errata-general.html#perl'}, {'name': "19980308 another /tmp race: `perl -e' opens temp file not safely", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=88932165406213&w=2'}, {'name': 'perl-e-tmp-symlink(7243)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7243.php'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 4.0 SP2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), possibly via malformed inputs or packets, such as those generated by a Linux smbmount command that was compiled on the Linux 2.0.29 kernel but executed on Linux 2.0.25.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19970402 Fatal bug in NT 4.0 server', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167420731&w=2'}, {'name': '19970403 Fatal bug in NT 4.0 server (more comments)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167420732&w=2'}, {'name': '19970407 DUMP of NT system crash', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167420741&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'passwd in SunOS 4.1.x allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack and the -F command line argument.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'US Robotics/3Com Total Control Chassis with Frame Relay between 3.6.22 and 3.7.24 does not properly enforce access filters when the "set host prompt" setting is made for a port, which allows attackers to bypass restrictions by providing the hostname twice at the "host: " prompt.'}]
reference: [{'name': '99', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99'}, {'name': '19980511 3Com/USR Total Control Chassis dialup port access filters', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221101925916&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'suidexec in suidmanager 0.18 on Debian 2.0 allows local users to gain root privileges by specifying a malicious program on the command line.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 with publicly accessible printers allows local users to gain privileges via a combination of the npd program and weak directory permissions.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in restore0.9 installation script in NeXT 1.0a and 1.0 allows local users to gain root privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Control Panel "Password Security" option for Apple Powerbooks allows attackers with physical access to the machine to bypass the security by booting it with an emergency startup disk and using a disk editor to modify the on/off toggle or password in the aaaaaaaAPWD file, which is normally inaccessible.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'BSD 4.4 based operating systems, when running at security level 1, allow the root user to clear the immutable and append-only flags for files by unmounting the file system and using a file system editor such as fsdb to directly modify the file through a device.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in Monitor utility (SYS$SHARE:SPISHR.EXE) in VMS 5.0 through 5.4-2 allows local users to gain privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in integer multiplication emulation code on SPARC architectures for SunOS 4.1 through 4.1.2 allows local users to gain root access or cause a denial of service (crash).'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Index Server 2.0 on IIS 4.0 stores physical path information in the ContentIndex\\Catalogs subkey of the AllowedPaths registry key, whose permissions allows local and remote users to obtain the physical paths of directories that are being indexed.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'iis-indexserver-reveal-path(7559)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7559.php'}, {'name': '19990323 Index Server 2.0 and the Registry', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=92242671024118&w=2'}, {'name': '19990323 Index Server 2.0 and the Registry', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=92223293409756&w=2'}, {'name': '476', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/476'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in xfsdump in SGI IRIX may allow local users to obtain root privileges via the bck.log log file, possibly via a symlink attack.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'spaceball program in SpaceWare 7.3 v1.0 in IRIX 6.2 allows local users to gain root privileges by setting the HOSTNAME environmental variable to contain the commands to be executed.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The Economist screen saver 1999 with the "Password Protected" option enabled allows users with physical access to the machine to bypass the screen saver and read files by running Internet Explorer while the screen is still locked.'}]
reference: [{'name': '466', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/466'}, {'name': '19990603 Huge Exploit in NT 4.0 SP5 Screensaver with Password Protection Enabled', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://archives.indenial.com/hypermail/ntbugtraq/1999/June1999/0007.html'}, {'name': '19990604 Official response from The Economist re: 1999 Screen Saver', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=92851653600852&w=2'}, {'name': '19990603 Re: Huge Exploit in NT 4.0 SP5 Screensaver with Password Protecti on Enabled.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://archives.indenial.com/hypermail/ntbugtraq/1999/June1999/0009.html'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in Desktop searchbook program in IRIX 5.0.x through 6.2 sets insecure permissions for certain user files (iconbook and searchbook).'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The access permissions for a UNIX domain socket are ignored in Solaris 2.x and SunOS 4.x, and other BSD-based operating systems before 4.4, which could allow local users to connect to the socket and possibly disrupt or control the operations of the program using that socket.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'sun-domain-socket-permissions(7172)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7172.php'}, {'name': '456', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/456'}, {'name': '19971003 Solaris 2.6 and sockets', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602248718482&w=2'}, {'name': '19970517 UNIX domain socket (Solarisx86 2.5)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602167418317&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'IBM/Tivoli OPC Tracker Agent version 2 release 1 creates files, directories, and IPC message queues with insecure permissions (world-readable and world-writable), which could allow local users to disrupt operations and possibly gain privileges by modifying or deleting files.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19981002 Several potential security problems in IBM/Tivoli OPC Tracker Age nt', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/10771'}, {'name': '382', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/382'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'IBM/Tivoli OPC Tracker Agent version 2 release 1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via malformed data to the localtracker client port (5011), which prevents the connection from being closed properly.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19981002 Several potential security problems in IBM/Tivoli OPC Tracker Age nt', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/10771'}, {'name': '382', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/382'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'snap command in AIX before 4.3.2 creates the /tmp/ibmsupt directory with world-readable permissions and does not remove or clear the directory when snap -a is executed, which could allow local users to access the shadowed password file by creating /tmp/ibmsupt/general/passwd before root runs snap -a.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990220 Re: snap utility for AIX.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91954824614013&w=2'}, {'name': '375', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/375'}, {'name': '19990217 snap utility for AIX.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91936783009385&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'dumpreg in Red Hat Linux 5.1 opens /dev/mem with O_RDWR access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) by redirecting fd 1 (stdout) to the kernel.'}]
reference: [{'name': '372', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/372'}, {'name': "19980730 FD's 0..2 and suid/sgid procs (Was: Crash a redhat 5.1 linux box)", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526192&w=2'}, {'name': '19980729 Crash a redhat 5.1 linux box', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526185&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ifdhcpc-done script for configuring DHCP on Red Hat Linux 5 allows local users to append text to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the dhcplog file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in AIX 4.1.4 and HP-UX 10.01 and 9.05 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) by using a socket to connect to a port on the localhost, calling shutdown to clear the socket, then using the same socket to connect to a different port on localhost.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The at program in IRIX 6.2 and NetBSD 1.3.2 and earlier allows local users to read portions of arbitrary files by submitting the file to at with the -f argument, which generates error messages that at sends to the user via e-mail.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'addnetpr in IRIX 5.3 and 6.2 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files and possibly gain root privileges via a symlink attack on the printers temporary file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The installation of the fsp package 2.71-10 in Debian GNU/Linux 2.0 adds the anonymous FTP user without notifying the administrator, which could automatically enable anonymous FTP on some servers such as wu-ftp.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'fsp-anon-ftp-access(7574)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7574.php'}, {'name': '19981128 Debian: Security flaw in FSP', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91228908407679&w=2'}, {'name': '19981130 Debian: Security flaw in FSP', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91244712808780&w=2'}, {'name': '316', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/316'}, {'name': '19990217 Debian GNU/Linux 2.0r5 released (fwd)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91936850009861&w=2'}, {'name': '19981126 new version of fsp fixes security flaw', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_DEBIAN'], 'url': 'http://lists.debian.org/debian-security-announce/debian-security-announce-1998/msg00033.html'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'A possible interaction between Apple MacOS X release 1.0 and Apache HTTP server allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a flood of HTTP GET requests to CGI programs, which generates a large number of processes.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990603 MacOS X system panic with CGI', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/14215'}, {'name': '306', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/306'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris 2.4 before kernel jumbo patch -35 allows set-gid programs to dump core even if the real user id is not in the set-gid group, which allows local users to overwrite or create files at higher privileges by causing a core dump, e.g. through dmesg.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'IBM Netfinity Remote Control allows local users to gain administrator privileges by starting programs from the process manager, which runs with system level privileges.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990525 Security Leak with IBM Netfinity Remote Control Software', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=92765856706547&w=2'}, {'name': '19990609 IBM\'s response to "Security Leak with IBM Netfinity Remote Control Software', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=92902484317769&w=2'}, {'name': '284', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/284'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in /usr/bin/mail in DEC ULTRIX before 4.2 allows local users to gain privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'AnswerBook2 (AB2) web server dwhttpd 3.1a4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via an HTTP POST request with a large content-length.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980823 Solaris ab2 web server is junk', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/10383'}, {'name': '253', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/253'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Format string vulnerability in AnswerBook2 (AB2) web server dwhttpd 3.1a4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via encoded % characters in an HTTP request, which is improperly logged.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980823 Solaris ab2 web server is junk', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/10383'}, {'name': '253', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/253'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ICQ99 ICQ web server build 1701 with "Active Homepage" enabled generates allows remote attackers to determine the existence of files on the server by comparing server responses when a file exists ("404 Forbidden") versus when a file does not exist ("404 not found").'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990501 Update: security hole in the ICQ-Webserver', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/13508'}, {'name': '246', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/246'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in nss_nisplus.so.1 library in NIS+ in Solaris 2.3 and 2.4 allows local users to gain root privileges.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "NBase switches NH2012, NH2012R, NH2015, and NH2048 have a back door password that cannot be disabled, which allows remote attackers to modify the switch's configuration."}]
reference: [{'name': '19980722 N-Base Vulnerability Advisory Followup', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526065&w=2'}, {'name': '212', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/212'}, {'name': '19980720 N-Base Vulnerability Advisory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526016&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'NBase switches NH208 and NH215 run a TFTP server which allows remote attackers to send software updates to modify the switch or cause a denial of service (crash) by guessing the target filenames, which have default names.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980722 N-Base Vulnerability Advisory Followup', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526065&w=2'}, {'name': '212', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/212'}, {'name': '19980720 N-Base Vulnerability Advisory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526016&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The default configuration of Slackware 3.4, and possibly other versions, includes . (dot, the current directory) in the PATH environmental variable, which could allow local users to create Trojan horse programs that are inadvertently executed by other users.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ping in Solaris 2.3 through 2.6 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) via a ping request to a multicast address through the loopback interface, e.g. via ping -i.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19970626 Solaris Ping bug (DoS)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602558319160&w=2'}, {'name': '19970627 SUMMARY: Solaris Ping bug (DoS)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602558319171&w=2'}, {'name': '00146', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_SUN'], 'url': 'http://sunsolve.sun.com/pub-cgi/retrieve.pl?doctype=coll&doc=secbull/146'}, {'name': '209', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/209'}, {'name': 'ping-multicast-loopback-dos(7492)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7492.php'}, {'name': '19971005 Solaris Ping Bug and other [bc] oddities', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602558319180&w=2'}, {'name': '19970627 Solaris Ping bug(inetsvc)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=87602558319181&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris Solstice AdminSuite (AdminSuite) 2.1 uses unsafe permissions when adding new users to the NIS+ password table, which allows local users to gain root access by modifying their password table entries.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris Solstice AdminSuite (AdminSuite) 2.1 incorrectly sets write permissions on source files for NIS maps, which could allow local users to gain privileges by modifying /etc/passwd.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris Solstice AdminSuite (AdminSuite) 2.1 follows symbolic links when updating an NIS database, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris Solstice AdminSuite (AdminSuite) 2.1 and 2.2 create lock files insecurely, which allows local users to gain root privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Solaris Solstice AdminSuite (AdminSuite) 2.1 and 2.2 allows local users to gain privileges via the save option in the Database Manager, which is running with setgid bin privileges.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'DIT TransferPro installs devices with world-readable and world-writable permissions, which could allow local users to damage disks through the ff device driver.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980105 Security flaw in either DIT TransferPro or Solaris', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=88419633507543&w=2'}, {'name': '204', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/204'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'PIM software for Royal daVinci does not properly password-protext access to data stored in the .mdb (Microsoft Access) file, which allows local users to read the data without a password by directly accessing the files with a different application, such as Access.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ZAK in Appstation mode allows users to bypass the "Run only allowed apps" policy by starting Explorer from Office 97 applications (such as Word), installing software into the TEMP directory, and changing the name to that for an allowed application, such as Winword.exe.'}]
reference: [{'name': '181', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/181'}, {'name': '19990107 WinNT, ZAK and Office 97', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91576100022688&w=2'}, {'name': '19990109 WinNT, ZAK and Office 97', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91606260910008&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Power management (Powermanagement) on Solaris 2.4 through 2.6 does not start the xlock process until after the sys-suspend has completed, which allows an attacker with physical access to input characters to the last active application from the keyboard for a short period after the system is restoring, which could lead to increased privileges.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980716 Security risk with powermanagemnet on Solaris 2.6', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104525997&w=2'}, {'name': '160', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/160'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'HP JetAdmin D.01.09 on Solaris allows local users to change the permissions of arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the /tmp/jetadmin.log file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'login in Slackware Linux 3.2 through 3.5 does not properly check for an error when the /etc/group file is missing, which prevents it from dropping privileges, causing it to assign root privileges to any local user who logs on to the server.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in libsocks5 library of Socks 5 (socks5) 1.0r5 allows local users to gain privileges via long environmental variables.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Ray Chan WWW Authorization Gateway 0.1 CGI program allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the "user" parameter.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ePerl 2.2.12 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files and possibly execute certain commands by specifying a full pathname of the target file as an argument to bar.phtml.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980707 ePerl: bad handling of ISINDEX queries', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104525890&w=2'}, {'name': '151', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/151'}, {'name': '19980710 ePerl Security Update Available', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104525927&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in /bin/mail in SunOS 4.1.1 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges via certain command line arguments.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'gcc 2.7.2 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on temporary .i, .s, or .o files.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980115 GCC 2.7.? /tmp files', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=88492937727193&w=2'}, {'name': '19980108 GCC Exploit', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=88524071002939&w=2'}, {'name': '19980102 Symlink bug with GCC 2.7.2', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=88419592307388&w=2'}, {'name': '146', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/146'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Win32 ICQ 98a 1.30, and possibly other versions, does not display the entire portion of long filenames, which could allow attackers to send an executable file with a long name that contains so many spaces that the .exe extension is not displayed, which could make the user believe that the file is safe to open from the client.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Linux 2.0.34 does not properly prevent users from sending SIGIO signals to arbitrary processes, which allows local users to cause a denial of service by sending SIGIO to processes that do not catch it.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Bug in AMD K6 processor on Linux 2.0.x and 2.1.x kernels allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) via a particular sequence of instructions, possibly related to accessing addresses outside of segments.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Micah Software Full Armor Network Configurator and Zero Administration allow local users with physical access to bypass the desktop protection by (1) using <CTRL><ALT><DEL> and kill the process using the task manager, (2) booting the system from a separate disk, or (3) interrupting certain processes that execute while the system is booting.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980609 Full Armor', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221103125869&w=2'}, {'name': '103', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103'}, {'name': '19980602 Full Armor.... Fool Proof etc... bugs', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221103125889&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'genkey utility in Alibaba 2.0 generates RSA key pairs with an exponent of 1, which results in transactions that are sent in cleartext.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in imapd and ipop3d in Slackware 3.4 and 3.3 with shadowing enabled, and possibly other operating systems, allows remote attackers to cause a core dump via a short sequence of USER and PASS commands that do not provide valid usernames or passwords.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internet Explorer 3 records a history of all URL\'s that are visited by a user in DAT files located in the Temporary Internet Files and History folders, which are not cleared when the user selects the "Clear History" option, and are not visible when the user browses the folders because of tailored displays.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19970805 Re: Strange behavior regarding directory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=87602837719654&w=2'}, {'name': '19970806 Re: Strange behavior regarding directory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=87602837719655&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internet Explorer 4.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via HTML code that contains a long CLASSID parameter in an OBJECT tag.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980730 Re: Object tag crashes Internet Explorer 4.0', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526188&w=2'}, {'name': '19980728 Object tag crashes Internet Explorer 4.0', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221104526169&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Eudora and Eudora Light before 3.05 allows remote attackers to cause a crash and corrupt the user's mailbox via an e-mail message with certain dates, such as (1) dates before 1970, which cause a Divide By Zero error, or (2) dates that are 100 years after the current date, which causes a segmentation fault."}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'SunOS 4.1.4 on a Sparc 20 machine allows local users to cause a denial of service (kernel panic) by reading from the /dev/tcx0 TCX device.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in (1) rlogin daemon rshd and (2) scheme on SCO UNIX OpenServer 5.0.5 and earlier, and SCO UnixWare 7.0.1 and earlier, allows remote attackers to gain privileges.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The Winmsdp.exe sample file in IIS 4.0 and Site Server 3.0 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'GINA in Windows NT 4.0 allows attackers with physical access to display a portion of the clipboard of the user who has locked the workstation by pasting (CTRL-V) the contents into the username prompt.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990205 Alert: MS releases GINA-fix for SP3, SP4, and TS', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91822011021558&w=2'}, {'name': '19990129 ole objects in a "secured" environment?', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=91788829326419&w=2'}, {'name': '19990129 ole objects in a "secured" environment?', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91764169410814&w=2'}, {'name': '198', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/198'}, {'name': 'nt-gina-clipboard(1975)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/1975'}, {'name': 'Q214802', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_MSKB'], 'url': 'http://support.microsoft.com/support/kb/articles/q214/8/02.asp'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internet Explorer 4 allows remote attackers (malicious web site operators) to read the contents of the clipboard via the Internet WebBrowser ActiveX object.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990222 New IE4 vulnerability : the clipboard again.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=91979439932341&w=2'}, {'name': '215', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/215'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Macromedia "The Matrix" screen saver on Windows 95 with the "Password protected" option enabled allows attackers with physical access to the machine to bypass the password prompt by pressing the ESC (Escape) key.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991004 Weakness In "The Matrix" Screensaver For Windows', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93915027622690&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'RSH service utility RSHSVC in Windows NT 3.5 through 4.0 does not properly restrict access as specified in the .Rhosts file when a user comes from an authorized host, which could allow unauthorized users to access the service by logging in from an authorized host.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'thttpd HTTP server 2.03 and earlier allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a GET request with more than one leading / (slash) character in the filename.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in thttpd HTTP server before 2.04-31 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a long date string, which is not properly handled by the tdate_parse function.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in at program in Digital UNIX 4.0 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long command line argument.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'BMC PATROL Agent before 3.2.07 allows local users to gain root privileges via a symlink attack on a temporary file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'BMC PATROL SNMP Agent before 3.2.07 allows local users to create arbitrary world-writeable files as root by specifying the target file as the second argument to the snmpmagt program.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990713 Root Perms Gained with Patrol SNMP Agent 3.2 (all others?)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93198293132463&w=2'}, {'name': '19990801 Re: Root Perms Gained with Patrol SNMP Agent 3.2 (all others?)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93372579004129&w=2'}, {'name': '525', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/525'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'inpview in InPerson on IRIX 5.3 through IRIX 6.5.10 trusts the PATH environmental variable to find and execute the ttsession program, which allows local users to obtain root access by modifying the PATH to point to a Trojan horse ttsession program.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in bb-hist.sh CGI History module in Big Brother 1.09b and 1.09c allows remote attackers to read portions of arbitrary files.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Windows NT 4.0 before SP3 allows remote attackers to bypass firewall restrictions or cause a denial of service (crash) by sending improperly fragmented IP packets without the first fragment, which the TCP/IP stack incorrectly reassembles into a valid session.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in Cisco IOS 11.1CC and 11.1CT with distributed fast switching (DFS) enabled allows remote attackers to bypass certain access control lists when the router switches traffic from a DFS-enabled interface to an interface that does not have DFS enabled, as described by Cisco bug CSCdk35564.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'J-016', 'tags': ['third-party-advisory', 'government-resource', 'x_refsource_CIAC'], 'url': 'http://ciac.llnl.gov/ciac/bulletins/j-016.shtml'}, {'name': '19981105 Cisco IOS DFS Access List Leakage', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_CISCO'], 'url': 'http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/770/iosdfsacl-pub.shtml'}, {'name': 'cisco-acl-leakage(1401)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/1401'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in Cisco IOS 11.1 through 11.3 with distributed fast switching (DFS) enabled allows remote attackers to bypass certain access control lists when the router switches traffic from a DFS-enabled input interface to an output interface with a logical subinterface, as described by Cisco bug CSCdk43862.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'J-016', 'tags': ['third-party-advisory', 'government-resource', 'x_refsource_CIAC'], 'url': 'http://ciac.llnl.gov/ciac/bulletins/j-016.shtml'}, {'name': '19981105 Cisco IOS DFS Access List Leakage', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_CISCO'], 'url': 'http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/770/iosdfsacl-pub.shtml'}, {'name': 'cisco-acl-leakage(1401)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/1401'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in Cisco routers versions 8.2 through 9.1 allows remote attackers to bypass access control lists when extended IP access lists are used on certain interfaces, the IP route cache is enabled, and the access list uses the "established" keyword.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in rcp on SunOS 4.0.x allows remote attackers from trusted hosts to execute arbitrary commands as root, possibly related to the configuration of the nobody user.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'rdist in various UNIX systems uses popen to execute sendmail, which allows local users to gain root privileges by modifying the IFS (Internal Field Separator) variable.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in w3-auth CGI program in miniSQL package allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an HTTP request with (1) a long URL, or (2) a long User-Agent MIME header.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Eastman Work Management 3.21 stores passwords in cleartext in the COMMON and LOCATOR registry keys, which could allow local users to gain privileges.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in passwd in BSD based operating systems 4.3 and earlier allows local users to gain root privileges by specifying a long shell or GECOS field.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Internet Explorer 4.0 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary text and HTML files on the user's machine via a small IFRAME that uses Dynamic HTML (DHTML) to send the data to the attacker, aka the Freiburg text-viewing issue."}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'When a Web site redirects the browser to another site, Internet Explorer 3.02 and 4.0 automatically resends authentication information to the second site, aka the "Page Redirect Issue."'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'PowerPoint 95 and 97 allows remote attackers to cause an application to be run automatically without prompting the user, possibly through the slide show, when the document is opened in browsers such as Internet Explorer.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'ProFTPd 1.2 compiled with the mod_sqlpw module records user passwords in the wtmp log file, which allows local users to obtain the passwords and gain privileges by reading wtmp, e.g. via the last command.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'A bug in Intel Pentium processor (MMX and Overdrive) allows local users to cause a denial of service (hang) in Intel-based operating systems such as Windows NT and Windows 95, via an invalid instruction, aka the "Invalid Operand with Locked CMPXCHG8B Instruction" problem.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in GNOME libraries 1.0.8 allows local user to gain root access via a long --espeaker argument in programs such as nethack.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The Sun HotSpot Performance Engine VM allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service on any server running HotSpot via a URL that includes the [ character.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990716 FW: (Review ID: 85125) Hotspot crashes bringing down webserver', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93240220324183&w=2'}, {'name': "19990706 Bug in SUN's Hotspot VM", 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93138827429589&w=2'}, {'name': 'sun-hotspot-vm(2348)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/2348'}, {'name': '522', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/522'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The textcounter.pl by Matt Wright allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': '(1) acledit and (2) aclput in AIX 4.3 allow local users to create or modify files via a symlink attack.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Squid 2.2.STABLE5 and below, when using external authentication, allows attackers to bypass access controls via a newline in the user/password pair.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991103 [squid]exploit for external authentication problem', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/33295'}, {'name': 'squid-proxy-auth-access(3433)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/3433'}, {'tags': ['x_refsource_CONFIRM'], 'url': 'http://www.squid-cache.org/Versions/v2/2.2/bugs/'}, {'name': '741', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/741'}, {'name': '19991025 [squid] exploit for external authentication problem', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/33295'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'SVGAlib zgv 3.0-7 and earlier allows local users to gain root access via a privilege leak of the iopl(3) privileges to child processes.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in zgv in svgalib 1.2.10 and earlier allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a long HOME environment variable.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in MSN Setup BBS 4.71.0.10 ActiveX control (setupbbs.ocx) allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands via the methods (1) vAddNewsServer or (2) bIsNewsServerConfigured.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'nsd in IRIX 6.5 through 6.5.2 exports a virtual filesystem on a UDP port, which allows remote attackers to view files and cause a possible denial of service by mounting the nsd virtual file system.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'sadc in IBM AIX 4.1 through 4.3, when called from programs such as timex that are setgid adm, allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in digest in AIX 4.3 allows printq users to gain root privileges by creating and/or modifing any file on the system.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'sdrd daemon in IBM SP2 System Data Repository (SDR) allows remote attackers to read files without authentication.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in TestChip function in XFree86 SuperProbe in Slackware Linux 3.1 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long -nopr argument.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'xosview 1.5.1 in Red Hat 5.1 allows local users to gain root access via a long HOME environmental variable.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980529 Re: Tiresome security hole in "xosview" (xosexp.c)', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221101926034&w=2'}, {'name': '19980528 ALERT: Tiresome security hole in "xosview", RedHat5.1?', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=90221101926021&w=2'}, {'name': '362', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/362'}, {'name': 'linux-xosview-bo(8787)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/8787.php'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'abuse.console in Red Hat 2.1 uses relative pathnames to find and execute the undrv program, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a path that points to a Trojan horse program.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in (1) diskperf and (2) diskalign in IRIX 6.4 allows local attacker to create arbitrary root owned files, leading to root privileges.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in crp in Hewlett Packard Apollo Domain OS SR10 through SR10.3 allows remote attackers to gain root privileges via insecure system calls, (1) pad_$dm_cmd and (2) pad_$def_pfk().'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'colorview in Silicon Graphics IRIX 5.1, 5.2, and 6.0 allows local attackers to read arbitrary files via the -text argument.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19950209-00-P', 'tags': ['vendor-advisory', 'x_refsource_SGI'], 'url': 'ftp://patches.sgi.com/support/free/security/advisories/19950209-01-P'}, {'name': '336', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/336'}, {'name': '19950307 sigh. another Irix 5.2 hole.', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.tryc.on.ca/archives/bugtraq/1995_1/0614.html'}, {'name': '19940809 Re: IRIX 5.2 Security Advisory', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/675'}, {'name': 'sgi-colorview(2112)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/2112'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'xtvscreen in SuSE Linux 6.0 allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the pic000.pnm file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Sudo 1.5 in Debian Linux 2.1 and Red Hat 6.0 allows local users to determine the existence of arbitrary files by attempting to execute the target filename as a program, which generates a different error message when the file does not exist.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Ipswitch IMail 5.0 and 6.0 uses weak encryption to store passwords in registry keys, which allows local attackers to read passwords for e-mail accounts.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Slackware Linux 3.4 pkgtool allows local attacker to read and write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the reply file.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'named in ISC BIND 4.9 and 8.1 allows local users to destroy files via a symlink attack on (1) named_dump.db when root kills the process with a SIGINT, or (2) named.stats when SIGIOT is used.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19980410 BIND 4.9.7 named follows symlinks, clobbers anything', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1/8966'}, {'name': '80', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/80'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internet Anywhere POP3 Mail Server 2.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via (1) LIST, (2) TOP, or (3) UIDL commands using letters as arguments.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991001 Vulnerabilities in the Internet Anywhere Mail Server', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=93880357530599&w=2'}, {'name': '733', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/733'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': '(1) ipxchk and (2) ipxlink in SGI OS2 IRIX 6.3 does not properly clear the IFS environmental variable before executing system calls, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflows in Quake 1.9 client allows remote malicious servers to execute arbitrary commands via long (1) precache paths, (2) server name, (3) server address, or (4) argument to the map console command.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Network Flight Recorder (NFR) 1.5 and 1.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service in nfrd (crash) via a TCP packet with a null header and data field.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Stalker Internet Mail Server 1.6 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service (crash) via a long HELO command.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in QuakeWorld 2.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long initial connect packet.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in SMI Sendmail 4.0 and earlier, on SunOS up to 4.0.3, allows remote attackers to access user bin.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Sun SunOS 4.1 through 4.1.3 allows local attackers to gain root access via insecure permissions on files and directories such as crash.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Web server in Tektronix PhaserLink Printer 840.0 and earlier allows a remote attacker to gain administrator access by directly calling undocumented URLs such as ncl_items.html and ncl_subjects.html.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991116 [Fwd: Printer Vulnerability: Tektronix PhaserLink Webserver gives Administrator Password]', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94286041430870&w=2'}, {'name': '806', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/806'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Directory traversal vulnerability in Etype Eserv 2.50 web server allows a remote attacker to read any file in the file system via a .. (dot dot) in a URL.'}]
reference: [{'name': '773', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/773'}, {'name': '19991104 Eserv 2.50 Web interface Server Directory Traversal Vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=94177470915423&w=2'}, {'name': '19991104 Eserv 2.50 Web interface Server Directory Traversal Vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94183041514522&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflows in Bisonware FTP server prior to 4.1 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service, and possibly execute arbitrary commands, via long (1) USER, (2) LIST, or (3) CWD commands.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflows in Xtramail 1.11 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary commands via (1) a long PASS command in the POP3 service, (2) a long HELO command in the SMTP service, or (3) a long user name in the Control Service.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'xtramail-pass-dos(3488)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/3488'}, {'name': '19991110 Multiples Remotes DoS Attacks in Artisoft XtraMail v1.11 Vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94226003804744&w=2'}, {'name': '791', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/791'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'The AMaViS virus scanner 0.2.0-pre4 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands as root via an infected mail message with shell metacharacters in the reply-to field.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'amavis-command-execute(2349)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/2349'}, {'tags': ['x_refsource_CONFIRM'], 'url': 'http://www.amavis.org/ChangeLog.txt'}, {'name': '19990716 AMaViS virus scanner for Linux - root exploit', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93219846414732&w=2'}, {'name': '527', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/527'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Management information base (MIB) for a 3Com SuperStack II hub running software version 2.10 contains an object identifier (.1.3.6.1.4.1.43.10.4.2) that is accessible by a read-only community string, but lists the entire table of community strings, which could allow attackers to conduct unauthorized activities.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in Celtech ExpressFS FTP server 2.x allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service, and possibly execute arbitrary commands, via a long USER command.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19990729 ExpressFS 2.x FTPServer remotely exploitable buffer overflow vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94121377716133&w=2'}, {'name': '19990729 ExpressFS 2.x FTPServer remotely exploitable buffer overflow vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_NTBUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=ntbugtraq&m=94130292519646&w=2'}, {'name': '749', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/749'}, {'name': 'expressfs-command-bo(3401)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/3401'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'A non-default configuration in TenFour TFS Gateway 4.0 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via messages with incorrect sender and recipient addresses, which causes the gateway to continuously try to return the message every 10 seconds.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'A buffer overflow in TenFour TFS Gateway SMTP mail server 3.2 allows an attacker to crash the mail server and possibly execute arbitrary code by offering more than 128 bytes in a MAIL FROM string.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'runtar in the Amanda backup system used in various UNIX operating systems executes tar with root privileges, which allows a user to overwrite or read arbitrary files by providing the target files to runtar.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991101 Amanda multiple vendor local root compromises', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94148942818975&w=2'}, {'name': '750', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/750'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Operating systems with shared memory implementations based on BSD 4.4 code allow a user to conduct a denial of service and bypass memory limits (e.g., as specified with rlimits) using mmap or shmget to allocate memory and cause page faults.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Gene6 G6 FTP Server 2.0 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via a long (1) user name or (2) password.'}]
reference: [{'name': 'g6ftp-username-dos(3513)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/3513'}, {'name': '19991117 Remote D.o.S Attack in G6 FTP Server v2.0 (beta 4/5) Vulnerability', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=94286244700573&w=2'}, {'name': '805', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_BID'], 'url': 'http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/805'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Computalynx CMail 2.4 and CMail 2.3 SP2 SMTP servers are vulnerable to a buffer overflow attack in the MAIL FROM command that may allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Vulnerability in htmlparse.pike in Roxen Web Server 1.3.11 and earlier, possibly related to recursive parsing and referer tags in RXML.'}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Buffer overflow in Sambar Web Server 4.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service, and possibly execute arbitrary commands, via a long HTTP GET request.'}]
reference: [{'name': '19991004', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93901161727373&w=2'}, {'name': 'sambar-logging-bo(1672)', 'tags': ['vdb-entry', 'x_refsource_XF'], 'url': 'https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/1672'}, {'name': '19991006 Re: Sample DOS against the Sambar HTTP-Server', 'tags': ['mailing-list', 'x_refsource_BUGTRAQ'], 'url': 'http://marc.info/?l=bugtraq&m=93941351229256&w=2'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'FlowPoint DSL router firmware versions prior to 3.0.8 allows a remote attacker to exploit a password recovery feature from the network and conduct brute force password guessing, instead of limiting the feature to the serial console port.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Macromedia Shockwave before 6.0 allows a malicious webmaster to read a user's mail box and possibly access internal web servers via the GetNextText command on a Shockwave movie."}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Auto-update feature of Macromedia Shockwave 7 transmits a user's password and hard disk information back to Macromedia."}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Internal HTTP server in Sun Netbeans Java IDE in Netbeans Developer 3.0 Beta and Forte Community Edition 1.0 Beta does not properly restrict access to IP addresses as specified in its configuration, which allows arbitrary remote attackers to access the server.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'cgiwrap as used on Cobalt RaQ 2.0 and RaQ 3i does not properly identify the user for running certain scripts, which allows a malicious site administrator to view or modify data located at another virtual site on the same system.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': "Buffer overflow in IBM HomePagePrint 1.0.7 for Windows98J allows a malicious Web site to execute arbitrary code on a viewer's system via a long IMG_SRC HTML tag."}]
[{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Netscape Messaging Server 3.54, 3.55, and 3.6 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion) via a series of long RCPT TO commands.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'Eicon Technology Diva LAN ISDN modem allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service (hang) via a long password argument to the login.htm file in its HTTP service.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': '.sbstart startup script in AcuShop Salesbuilder is world writable, which allows local users to gain privileges by appending commands to the file.'}]

description: [{'lang': 'en', 'value': 'IIS 3.x and 4.x does not distinguish between pages requiring encryption and those that do not, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource exhaustion) via SSL requests to the HTTPS port for normally unencrypted files, which will cause IIS to perform extra work to send the files over SSL.'}]

[{'lang': 'en', 'value': "When IIS 2 or 3 is upgraded to IIS 4, ism.dll is inadvertently left in /scripts/iisadmin, which does not restrict access to the local machine and allows an unauthorized user to gain access to sensitive server information, including the Administrator's password."}]
